page.title: 07UPPIES AND DOWNIES
page.content: One of Workington's oldest traditions is the uppies and downies game that takes place annually around the Easter holiday time.The game is very similar to the old football played in Elizabethan times.The men and boys of the town are divided into two teams according to where they live.The object of the game is for one team to score a goal by taking the ball which is a little smaller than a football and very much harder and heavier and place it in or on the opponents goal .The ball can be transported in any way kicking or carrying and basically there are no real rules .To tackle a member of the other team a man can kick or punch to get the ball.The game usually has a large turnout of both players and spectators .Unfortunately there have been many accidents and even some deaths.
